alert.note: Alert for St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 12 at 10:23AM AST until December 16 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST FRIDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous surf conditions and rip currents expected due to breaking waves of up to 15 feet. Localized beach erosion and coastal flooding is possible. * WHERE...Beaches from northwestern to northeastern Puerto Rico, Culebra, St. Thomas, St. John and Adjacent Islands. * WHEN...Through 6 PM AST Friday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming conditions. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Hazardous breaking waves.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. All persons should refrain from entering the waters, due to the risks associated with high surf conditions and rip currents.
